Stephen Drennan
@babuyagu

Paul Tierney has awarded Manchester United 5 penalties in his last 10 matches - and 1 against.

He has awarded Liverpool 0 penalties in 14 matches - and 1 against (Chelsea).

His place of residence is "Lancashire" according to Transfermarkt.

Btw - the point of 'Lancashire' isn't to say he supports United. You can live right next door to a clubs stadium and absolutely despise them.

But people local to football clubs shouldn't ref high profile games. They, their friends or family are far more likely to have an vested

in the outcome than a referee from Bournemouth or Norwich. And as they are only human - and Oliver admitted this week the occasion was on his mind in the Merseyside Derby when judging the Pickford incident - that can unconsciously bias decision making.
